reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was pretty good, and reasonably priced (for a big city). The location was very convenient - an easy walk to the city center and close to the hospitals. The room was very small - there is just enough space for the bed and 2 bags. The mattress was on the firmer side, although fairly comfortable. There was, unfortunately, no fan in the bedroom which would have been nice to drown out the city noise! There was also no fan in the bathroom, which got very steamy after a shower. The shower had a very fine line between hot and cold water, you had to get the tap in just the right location which was a bit annoying. If you like to have an extra pillow to sleep with you'll have to ask at reception, as the only extra ones were the decorative type covered in not-often-washed covers.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have booked Soho for 2 nights stay via agoda.com. So we have been bit surprised when we arrived to Soho and it is actually a motel, not hotel as presented at agoda.com. However, the location was good, close to center (8min. walk through the park). The downside about location was only that is on the hill, so when going back elderly people might have bit trouble going uphill.
reviews.title: no lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.title: Basic, Clean, Great Value and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - small in a case you have 2 big suitcases and hand luggage as us (you hardly can store them not open it).
reviews.title: Ok for price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: - the twin beds where very comfortable and clean
reviews.title: SOHO - So Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Soho Motel is great value and location for a stop over. We stayed there for a night on our way to Vanuatu. What it might lack in a few amenities (lift, 24 hour reception), it makes up for in location, convenience, service friendliness, cleanliness, and value.
reviews.title: Great value and location for a stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is reasonably priced and very convenient for public transport, being a 15 minute walk from Roma Street Station. This will get you pretty much anywhere on the rail network in Brisbane, including to and from the domestic and international airport terminals on the AirTrain.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an uphill walk so if you are not very mobile and can't tackle hill walks then it may not be for you (we're in our mid 50s and not particularly fit but managed it comfortably with our cabin bags and luggage). However, the walk back to the station is downhill and very enjoyable around the Roma Street parklands.
reviews.title: Very comfortable tiny hotel near Brisbane CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Ideal for break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is more in the way of a sort of boutique hotel than a motel. There is no lift so if you are not capable of carrying your bags upstairs then either ask for a room on the ground floor (these are the 200 series rooms) or find a hotel with a lift.
reviews.title: Basic hotel but good location and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this place based on the fact that we wanted somewhere central in Brisbane with parking (preferably free). It was easy to get to and parking was ok. The rooms are small, but that was expected. Cleanliness was good and to me the decor didn't seem to worn compared to other similarily priced alternatives.
reviews.title: Good location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great and very central and if you are a normally fit person the hill should not be a problem at all.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was a bit surprised that they needed to know in advance exactly when we would be arriving as it was within their normal check-in time, but maybe that is the norm in Australia?
reviews.title: A so-so stay at the Soho, but still great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The motel is in a great location within easy walking distance to the heart of Brisbane. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are gorgeous but just a little too small. Really enjoyed breakfast aswell so no complaints!
reviews.title: Great place for a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have very fond memories of staying at the Soho on numerous occasions in the mid/late 2000s, and returned there last weekend for the first time in a few years. Of course, nothing has changed its great location - just a short walk (admittedly uphill, so won't suit some) from the CBD, and within easy access of Roma Street station (and the airport train), and with the impressive Roma Street parklands virtually on the doorstep. My queen size bed was very comfortable and the level of cleanliness was good. I was also pleased to see that the hotel rooms now have free, unlimited and fast wi-fi access, and new flat-screen TVs and iPod docking stations.
reviews.title: Rude and Unhelpful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive: central location, helpful staff, balcony, car parking, free average breakfast, free wifi and reasonable price.
reviews.title: Good location but very small rooms desperately needing restoration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Negative: very small and timeworn rooms and bathrooms, noisy aircon, and we had to request another room because the door to the balcony of the first one could not open.
reviews.title: Small room but great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: May be recommended as a budget motel, but for very short stay.
reviews.title: nice and close to Brisbane city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hint to the owner: It is urgent to refurbish your property.
reviews.title: location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: My son and I stayed in a twin share room at this hotel for 2 nights. Ideal central location, can walk to the Queen St mall in 5 minutes. Hotel provides car parking which is at a premium that close in the city. Cleanliness was fine. Staff always polite and very helpful. My son appreciated the free WiFi. The room was small - but not an issue if you aren't there much of the day. Didn't try the restaurant so can't comment. Price reasonable for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Good location,very helpful staff.
